list_definition.definition: a violent storm with winds blowing at over 120 kilometres/kilometers per hour

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They forecast a hurricane for the Southeastern US.

list_ex_of_english: The effect of a hurricane covers a greater area and produces many gaps comprising multiple treefalls, and may therefore produce more noticeable or different effects.
A significant effect of time since disturbance would indicate a consistent linear response to elapsed time following a hurricane, regardless of identity.
Immediately following a hurricane, when environmental conditions are most extreme, they exhibit low densities.
One is taken by the hurricane or the currents and is shipwrecked.
Large disturbances, such as hurricanes and fires, are absent; thus, individual treefalls and small windstorms are the sole natural source of canopy turnover.
Relative variability of the total snail assemblage was unaffected by either hurricane identity or time since disturbance.
In all but the hurricane domains the dominant issue on the agenda changes when an event is specifically mentioned.
The dominant issue in the hurricane domain - disaster relief - remains constant because there is no obvious advocacy coalition in the hurricane domain.
